column2: OKLAHOMA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.
column6: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column8: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column10: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column8: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 4. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column8: by slowing down and making sure they are being seen by pedestrians.
column10: when pedestrians are crossing within a marked or unmarked crosswalk.

column2: 5. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column6: is the best option during winter.
column8: causes the front wheels to lock.

column2: 6. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 7. Drivers may exceed the speed limit when passing another vehicle.
8. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column6: yield to the vehicle to your left.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your right.

column2: 9. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brake firmly and stop.
column6: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.
column8: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: A four-way intersection is ahead

column2: 11. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should stop walking immediately.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 12. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column8: at intersections.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycle crossing
column10: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 15. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 16. This sign means:
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Divided highway ends.

column2: 17. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column8: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

column2: 18. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column6: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.
column8: always have the right of way.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: Lane shifting
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 20. When pedestrians are in a crosswalk, drivers should:
column4: go ahead because drivers have the right-of-way.
column6: pull over to the right and stop.
column8: wait for them to cross.

column2: 21. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Flashing red light

column2: 22. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 23. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 24. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 25. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Merge left.
column10: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
